title: Appropriates $10 million to the division of housing and community renewal to assist municipalities in housing demolition
summary: Makes a one-time appropriation of $10 million to the division of housing and community renewal to assist municipalities in the demolition and removal of abandoned or dangerous housing; authorizes the distribution of grants in amounts not to exceed $750,000 for any one municipality in any one year.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2052

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
making an appropriation to the division of housing and community renewal
for housing demolition assistance

PURPOSE/SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
To make a one time appropriation of $10
million to the Division of Housing and Community Renewal to assist
municipalities in the demolition and removal of abandoned or
dangerous housing.

JUSTIFICATION:
Consistent with the objectives of the 1996 Legislative
Report of the Senate Democratic Task Force on the Financing of
Affordable Housing this bill will assist localities with the costs of
demolishing abandoned, dilapidated and unsafe housing structures
within their municipal boundaries. New York state's urban areas have
witnessed a sharp increase in the level of inhabitable and dangerous
housing stock, yet have not seen an increase in funding availability
for addressing this situation. without removing these structures, our
communities and quality of life will continue to decline, housing
sales and housing starts will continue to plunge, and the genuine
safety of our neighbors will be put in jeopardy. Law enforcement
leaders from across the state have repeatedly noted that these
housing structures are routinely used for illegal activities and must
be closed and removed. This bill will not only increase the
liveability of our neighborhoods, but it will also assist in fighting
crime and ensuring the safety of our children and families.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
There will be a one time appropriation of $10
million from the General Fund.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect immediately.
